dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 965 IH: To prohibit the possession or transfer of junk guns, also known as Saturday Night Specials.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Gutierrez introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To prohibit the possession or transfer of junk guns, also known as Saturday Night Specials.

section.header: Prohibition against possession or transfer of junk guns, also known as saturday night specials

subsection.text: Section 922 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: It shall be unlawful for any person to possess or transfer a junk gun which has been shipped or transported in interstate or foreign commerce.
Paragraph (1) shall not apply to the continuous and otherwise lawful possession of a junk gun by a person during any period that began before the effective date of this subsection.

subsection.text: Section 921(a) of such title is amended by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: a handgun that is not a sporting handgun; and
any combination of parts from which a handgun described in clause (i) can be assembled.

subparagraph.text: The term sporting handgun means a handgun which the Secretary has determined, using the criteria applied in making determinations under section 925(d)(3), to be of a type generally recognized as particularly suitable for or readily adaptable to sporting purposes.

subsection.text: Section 924(a)(1)(B) of such title is amended by inserting or (aa) before of.
